TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SignerInfoCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: The SignerInfoCollection class represents a collection of objects. SignerInfoCollection implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class does not have a public constructor; therefore, it cannot be publicly instantiated. It is a read-only class accessible from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SignedCms.SignerInfos%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property or the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SignerInfo.CounterSignerInfos%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

Docs.summary: The Count property retrieves the number of items in the collection.
Docs.value: An int value that represents the number of items in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SignerInfoEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: The GetEnumerator method returns a object for the collection.
The IsSynchronized property retrieves whether access to the collection is synchronized, or thread safe. This property always returns , which means the collection is not thread safe.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Boolean> value of , which means the collection is not thread safe.

Docs.param: An int value that represents the index in the collection. The index is zero based.
Docs.summary: The Item property retrieves the object at the specified index in the collection.
Docs.value: A object at the specified index.
Docs.exception: The value of an argument was outside the allowable range of values as defined by the called method.

Docs.summary: The SyncRoot property retrieves an <xref:System.Object> object is used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Object> object is used to synchronize access to the collection.
